channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Tour bus rollover kills 5 on interstate highway in western New York
item.description: A tour bus returning to New York City from Niagara Falls with 54 people on board crashed and rolled on a highway near Pembroke, killing five passenger...

item.title: As Trump touts D.C. arrests, experts caution they're not the best indicator of public safety
item.description: The Trump administration says it has arrested more than 700 people in Washington, D.C., in its mission to crack down on crime. Experts say it's diffic...

item.title: 8/22: CBS Mornings Plus
item.description: Erik Menendez denied parole in California hearing. Also, Jeep CEO Bob Broderdorf unveils hybrid Cherokee.

item.title: 8/22: CBS Evening News
item.description: Everything we know about the deadly tour bus crash in upstate New York; Giant beach tents are taking over shorelines and not everyone is happy

item.title: 8/22: The Daily Report
item.description: Jericka Duncan reports on a deadly New York bus crash, the DOJ's release of interview transcripts with Epstein associate Ghislaine Maxwell, and more.

item.title: Judge blocks Trump from cutting funding to dozens of "sanctuary" cities

item.title: 8/22: CBS Evening News Plus
item.description: What's next for Kilmar Abrego Garcia after release from jail; Reporter's Notebook: When smashing trains was an American pastime

item.title: Famine is declared in Gaza: What does it take to make this pronouncement?
item.description: An announcement of famine — as has now happened regarding Gaza — is a complicated decision. Here's what must be considered before such a declaration i...

item.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia released from federal custody pending criminal trial
item.description: The case of Abrego Garcia, a Maryland man originally from El Salvador, raised basic questions of due process in Trump's crackdown on undocumented immi...

item.title: Intel will give the U.S. government a 10% stake, Trump says
item.description: The president's highly unusual announcement underscores the Trump administration's desire to take control over U.S. businesses.

item.title: Russia is trying to stop meeting on peace and prolong war, Zelensky says
item.description: Volodymyr Zelensky urges Western allies to impose fresh sanctions on Moscow if it shows no interest in peace.

item.title: Sri Lanka's former president Ranil Wickremesinghe arrested
item.description: Ranil Wickremesinghe has been arrested in connection with the alleged misuse of funds, officials said.

item.title: Canada to drop some of its retaliatory tariffs on the US
item.description: The move comes after the two countries blew past a self-imposed deadline to reach a trade agreement.

item.title: Takeaways from Justice Department interviews of Epstein’s former girlfriend, Ghislaine Maxwell
Epstein’s former girlfriend told Justice Department she did not see Trump act in ‘inappropriate way’
How Israel's policies created famine in Gaza
item.description: Israel has systematically obstructed food entering Gaza, aid agencies say, as a UN-backed body confirms a famine.

item.title: Will Serena Williams's weight-loss admission help shed stigma of anti-obesity drugs?
item.description: Could her comments instil a new sense of confidence in those using the drugs and quieten the critics?
